intro: Rubus conspersus, commonly known as the bristly blackberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces aggregate fruits, known as drupes, which are typically dark purple to black in color. It is native to regions of North America and is often found in moist, disturbed habitats. The botanical features of Rubus conspersus make it an important species for ecological studies and local biodiversity.
